sourceOrganization.name: NIAID IeDEA Consortium
sourceOrganization.abstract: The International Epidemiology Databases to Evaluate AIDS (IeDEA) Cohort Consortium is a global research consortium that harmonizes and pools HIV/AIDS data from seven international regions. This collaborative effort supports large-scale epidemiological studies to improve HIV/AIDS treatment and prevention strategies worldwide.
sourceOrganization.description: The International Epidemiology Databases to Evaluate AIDS (IeDEA) Cohort Consortium collaborates to collect and define key variables, harmonize data, and implement methodology to effectively pool data as a cost-effective means of generating large data sets. IeDEA collects HIV/AIDS data from seven international regional data centers, including four in Africa, and one each in the Asia-Pacific region, the Central/South America/Caribbean region, and North America. For more information, visit the NIAID program page: https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/iedea-cohort-consortium
alternateName: International Epidemiology Databases to Evaluate AIDS Cohort Consortium
